p: Although associated with warming rather than drought, projections of increased precipitation in the winter months followed by reduced precipitation in the summer months for North America are thought to favor the dispersal of Blastomyces dermatitidis spores, which causes blastomycosis [ 142]. Currently, this fungus occurs mainly in northwestern Ontario [ 142]. Between 1994 and 2003, there were 309 cases of blastomycosis in Ontario with more than half of the cases occurring between 2001 and 2003 [ 151]. Geographically, northern Ontario accounted for 61% of the cases, followed by 21% from the Toronto region [ 151].
